poem:
### Ceasefire

In the grey corridors,  
echoes of a handshake  
whisper across the fields—  
a distant war-torn hymn.  
Hope, a silent dove,  
circles above, unseen  
by the weary eyes of men,  
who ponder the cost  
of iron-clasped voices  
wishing stillness  
in a broken land,  
arms extended,  
holding only shadows.
